title.text: A computerized dictionary : Le Trésor de la langue française informatisé (TLFi)

abstractContent.text: This paper presents one of the main computerized resources of the research Laboratory ATILF (Analyse et traitement informatique de la langue française) available via the Web: the computerized dictionary TLFi (Trésor de la langue française informatisé).

Its highly detailed XML structure (over 3,6 million tags) is powered by Stella: the extended capacities and potentialities of this software allows high level queries as well as hypernavigation through and between different databases.

introductionContent.text: A dictionary, in its electronic form, is a textual database to be used in any natural language processing system.
The size and the contents of the existing dictionaries vary a lot according to the target of the attended public and the cost of their collected resources.
In the article, we present one of our textual resources, the TLFi which is the most important computerized dictionary on French language.
It is accessible via the web at http://www.atilf.fr/tlfi.
